name: 2D Rope System (Paid)
description: Scripts for creating any type of 2D ropes in the editor or during runtime.

name: Ferr2D Terrain Tool (Paid)
description: Quickly create handcrafted 2D landscapes and levels.

name: Pixel Camera 2D
description: A simple pixel perfect camera with scaling options for 2D Games.

name: Spine (Paid)
description: A skeletal animation editor with a Unity library.

name: Tiled2Unity
description: Takes your Tiled files and creates Unity prefabs from them that are easily placed into your Unity scene. Complex collision is supported through Unity’s PolygonCollider2D class.

name: Unity Anima2D
description: Advanced skeletal animation editor with support for both per-object and skinned mesh animation with an integrated in-editor skinning tool.

name: UnityTiled
description: An importer for Tiled maps.

name: ARToolKit
description: Augmented Reality SDK that includes libraries, utilities, and examples.

name: Google VR SDK
description: Scripts and prefabs to help with the development of Google Daydream and Cardboard apps for Android and iOS.

name: SteamVR Unity Toolkit
description: Scripts and Great examples to abstract the use of VR controller actions in Unity.

name: Virtual Reality Toolkit
description: Virtual Reality framework that allows for powerful interactions, locomotion, and visual effects.

name: Vuforia
description: Augmented Reality SDK with image and object recognition, smart terrain and extended tracking features.

name: UFPS (Paid)
description: Provides camera, controllers, and other effects for use in FPS games.

name: CharacterController2D
description: A 2D controller that behaves very similarly to Unity's CharacterController component.

name: Fungus
description: An easy to use Unity 3D library for creating illustrated Interactive Fiction games.

name: StrangeIoC
description: Strange is a super-lightweight and highly extensible Inversion-of-Control (IoC) framework, written specifically for C# and Unity.

name: uFrame (Paid)
description: Create maintainable games faster, better, more stable, and consistent than ever before.

name: InControl
description: An input manager that tames makes handler cross-platform. controller input easy.

name: InputBinder
description: Bind game inputs to methods via code or using the inspector to add event driven input handling to your project.

name: TouchKit
description: Makes it easy to recognize gestures and other touch input.

name: TouchScript
description: Makes handling complex gesture interactions on any touch surface much easier.

name: SabreCSG
description: A set of CSG level design tools for building complex levels quickly inside Unity.

name: Unity Monetization
description: Unity Ads is a video ad network with quick and seamless integration using regular and opt-in ads.

name: Nakama
description: Build social and realtime games with an open-source distributed server.

name: Photon Bolt (Paid)
description: Build networked games without having to know the details of networking or write any complex networking code.

name: Photon Unity Networking
description: Plug and play cloud networking that also works for local hosting. Free for up to 20 concurrent users.

name: Easy Save 2 (Paid)
description: A fast and simple way to save and load data on all major platforms supported by Unity.

name: UniStorm (Paid)
description: A customizable dynamic day and night weather system that creates realistic storms and weather.

name: Unity Analytics
description: Provides a dashboard with metrics to help track active players, sessions, retention, and revenue.

name: DOTween
description: Tween any numeric property or field (including Vectors, Rectangles, etc.), plus some non-numeric ones (like strings). This is the follow-up to HOTween.

name: GoKit
description: An open source, lightweight tween library aimed at making tweening objects dead simple.

name: iTween
description: A simple, and easy to use animation system.

name: LeanTween
description: FOSS, and also the most lightweight tweening library for Unity. Allows you to tween any value you have access to via the .value() method.

name: NGUI (Paid)
description: A powerful UI system and event notification framework.

name: TextMesh Pro
description: A alternative to render text in uGUI by using the distance field technique, which allows crisp fonts at any scale. This was recently purchased by Unity and will be integrated into the engine in the future.

name: Consolation
description: In-game debug console that displays output from Debug.Log.

name: GitHub for Unity
description: The new GitHub for Unity extension brings the GitHub workflow and more to Unity, providing support for large files with Git LFS and file locking.

name: Grouping Tool
description: Easily group objects together

name: Scene View Bookmarks
description: Editor extension to bookmark and later recall scene views.

name: SnazzyGrid (Paid)
description: Makes it easy to manage positions of assets in the scene with easy to use snapping tools and many more features to improve the scene creation workflow.

name: UniMerge (Paid)
description: Editor extension for merging scenes and prefabs, also integrates with VCS.

name: UniRx
description: UniRx (Reactive Extensions for Unity) is a reimplementation of the .NET Reactive Extensions. Rx cures the "asynchronous blues" without async/await.

name: UnityToolbag
description: Collection of miscellaneous open source scripts and helpers for Unity 5.0.

name: Vimeo Unity SDK
description: Easily stream your Vimeo videos into Unity or record and publish out to Vimeo.

name: Playmaker (Paid)
description: Quickly make gameplay prototypes, A.I. behaviors, animation graphs, interactive objects, and more using finite state machines.

name: Nodulus
description: A complete puzzle game with a clever twist. Play it online.

name: Editor Tips
description: Tips in gif form showing a few ways to use the editor more efficiently.

name: Unity Labs' Super Science
description: Gems of Unity Labs for user education.

name: Unity Tips
description: Short videos showing some handy tips when using Unity.

name: 2D Splatter Effects Using the Stencil Buffer
description: Using the stencil buffer in Unity to draw splatter effects on surfaces. This could be used for paint or blood splatter.

name: A Gentle Introduction to Shaders in Unity3D
description: This series of posts will  introduce you to shader coding, and is oriented to developers with little to no knowledge about shaders.

name: Amit’s Game Programming Information
description: An great collection of general purpose game programming content.

name: Catlike Coding
description: Tutorials designed for learning the C# scripting side of Unity.

name: Fixing Gaps Between Sprites
description: A short tutorial about removing the small gaps that sometimes appear between adjacent sprites.

name: Game Programming Patterns
description: Lots of great game development patterns useful when making games with or without Unity.

name: Modern GUI Development in Unity 4.6
description: A video tutorial providing an in-depth explanation of Unity's new UI system.

name: Official Video Tutorials
description: The official tutorials for scripting, animation, audio, and almost anything Unity related.

name: Ray Wenderlich's Tutorials
description: Beginner and mid-level tutorials focused on learning Unity features or creating small example games.

name: Unity in HoloLens
description: Official tutorials from Microsoft for creating Microsoft HoloLens applications.

name: Unity Virtual Reality
description: Unity's official documentation on developing virtual reality applications.
